sen.j: 木邊 孝慈（きべ こうじ、1881年－1969年）は、真宗木辺派の僧侶。
sen.e: Koji Kibe (1881-1969) was a priest in the Shinshu-kibe sect of Jodo Shinshu Buddhism.
Koji Kibe (1881-1969) was a priest in the Shinshu-kibe sect of Jodo Shinshu Buddhism.
Koji KIBE (1881-1969) was a priest in the Shinshu-kibe school of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism).

sen.j: 西本願寺21世法主 大谷光尊の次男、22世法主 大谷光瑞の弟。
sen.e: He was the second son of Priest Koson Otani, the 21st head priest of Nishi-Hongwanji Temple, and the younger brother of the 22nd Priest Kozui Otani.
He was the second son of Priest Koson Otani, the 21st head priest of Nishi-Hongwanji Temple, and the younger brother of the 22nd Priest Kozui Otani.
He was the second son of Priest Koson OTANI, the 21st head priest of Nishi-Hongan-ji Temple, and the younger brother of the 22nd Priest Kozui OTANI.

sen.j: 妹に歌人の九条武子がいる。
sen.e: One of his younger sisters was the singer Takeko Kujo.
One of his younger sisters was the singer Takeko Kujo.
One of his younger sisters was the singer Takeko KUJO.

sen.j: 当時、真宗木辺派に後継者がいなかったので、17歳で本山・錦織寺に入り第20代法主を継ぐ。
sen.e: As there was no successor in the Shinshu-kibe sect at the time, he entered the head temple, Kinshokuji Temple at the age of 17 and succeeded to the position of 20th Head Priest.

As there was no successor in the Shinshu-kibe school at the time, he entered the head temple, Kinshoku-ji Temple at the age of 17 and succeeded to the position of 20th Head Priest.

sen.j: 法隆寺の佐伯定胤に唯識の講義を受けている。
sen.e: He received lectures in Yuishiki doctrine from Priest Join Saeki of Horyuji.
He received lectures in Yuishiki doctrine from Priest Join Saeki of Horyuji.
He received lectures in Yuishiki doctrine from Priest Join SAEKI of Horyu-ji Temple.

sen.j: 学徳共に秀で人望も厚かった。
sen.e: He was a man of superior wisdom and virtue, and he was highly respected.

sen.j: 1940年、大日本仏教会会長となる。
sen.e: In 1940 he became Chairman of the Japan Buddhist Federation.
